value.name: Tories will not be wiped out in Scotland, says Sunak
value.description: But SNP Westminster leader Stephen Flynn said: “Scotland hasn’t voted for the Tories since 1955 and in every Scottish Tory seat the SNP is best placed to get rid of them.

value.name: Tories will not be wiped out in Scotland, says Sunak
value.description: But SNP Westminster leader Stephen Flynn said: “Scotland hasn’t voted for the Tories since 1955 and in every Scottish Tory seat the SNP is best placed to get rid of them.

value.name: Rishi Sunak insists Scottish Tories don't face wipe-out: 'Very confident'
value.description: THE Tories will not be wiped out in Scotland at the next General Election, the Prime Minister has said. Speaking to journalist during a visit to RAF Lossiemouth in Moray, Rishi Sunak was asked whether he was concerned about an electoral wipeout.

value.name: Labour flip-flops on its pledge to clear the NHS waiting list despite Keir Starmer previously saying it would aim to remove the backlog during its first term in office
value.description: Health spokesman Wes Streeting yesterday appeared to dump that commitment, as he announced plans to increase the number of evening and weekend appointments,

value.name: General Election 'will be held in 2024', Prime Minister confirms
value.description: The next UK General Election will be held in 2024, the Prime Minister has confirmed tonight (Monday). There had been reports the polls could be held in January 2025 under the Fixed Term Parliament Act.

mentions.name: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

value.name: Michelle Mone is urged not to return to the House of Lords as she blasts Rishi Sunak over PPE and claims 'they all knew' about her involvement
value.description: Conservative minister Lord Callanan said Lady Mone 'should have declared her involvement' with PPE Medpro and hoped she would 'see sense' and not return to the red benches

value.name: Mone’s Lords future questioned as PPE row grows
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer said Baroness Mone should not be a member of the House of Lords, describing the PPE scandal as a "shocking disgrace from top to bottom".

value.name: Rishi Sunak confirms election will be next year, despite legal right to wait until January 2025
value.description: Rishi Sunak has confirmed this evening that a general election will be held next year in 2024, despite speculation that the prime minister could hold off until January 2025.  Under the Dissolution and Calling of Parliament Act 2022,

value.name: Kent County Council braced for job and service cuts as ‘hugely disappointing’ government funding deal falls short – says Tory chief
value.description: A council leader has warned fresh service cuts could be on the way as he reacts to the government’s ‘huge disappointing’ funding settlement.

value.name: Michelle Mone and ministers trade claims over her hidden links to PPE deals
value.description: Disgraced Tory peer claims government always knew of her involvement in Covid contracts as calls mount for her to stay out of Lords

value.name: Michael Gove could be called before Covid inquiry over Baroness Mone PPE row
value.description: The peer launched a series of attacks on Rishi Sunak and other government figures on social media after she admitted lying to the media about her links to PPE firm MedPro

value.name: UK increases pressure on Israel over civilian death toll in Gaza
value.description: Rishi Sunak increased the pressure on Israel over the civilian death toll in Gaza by reiterating calls for a “sustainable ceasefire” that were ramped up by Lord Cameron at the weekend.

mentions.name: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom

value.name: Alistair Darling memorial service to be held in Edinburgh on Tuesday
value.description: A MEMORIAL service for the former Chancellor of the Exchequer Alistair Darling will take place in Edinburgh on Tuesday.

value.name: What you need to know about Michelle Mone and the PPE scandal
value.description: The entrepreneur admitted in a Sunday interview with the BBC's Laura Kuenssberg that she stood to benefit from the £60 million profit made by PPE Medpro.

value.name: Life of Alistair Darling to be celebrated at memorial service in Edinburgh
value.description: Alistair Darling died on November 30, aged 70, following a stay in hospital where he was being treated for cancer.

value.name: Sunak embroiled in bitter row with Michelle Mone over Covid contracts
value.description: Prime minister tries to distance himself from Tory peer who admitted gaining from profits of company that won state contracts during pandemic

value.name: Keir Starmer confident NHS staff will work weekends to clear waiting lists
value.description: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer during a visit to the theatre recovery ward in the Bexley Wing of St James' University Hospital in Leeds “They are happy to volunteer for it and there was a certain pride among the team about doing it,” said Sir Keir.

value.name: Israel-Gaza war live: US support for Israel ‘unshakeable’ but protecting Gaza civilians ‘a moral duty’, says defence secretary
value.description: US secretary Lloyd Austin said Israel ‘has every right’ to defend itself against Hamas but reiterates need for pathway forward and protecting civilians

value.name: Michelle Mone: Ministers knew about my links to PPE firm
value.description: Sir Keir Starmer said the peer should be expelled from the Lords after she admitted lying about her involvement in PPE Medpro.

value.name: Michelle Mone hits back at Rishi Sunak: Ministers knew all along about my involvement with PPE firm
value.description: Baroness Mone claims key departments knew about her links to PPE Medpro ‘from the beginning’ after the PM said he was taking allegations against her ‘very seriously’

video.name: Lying to press over PPE contract was ‘not a crime’ says Michelle Mone

value.name: Sunak raises concerns about Gaza death toll as senior Tories push for ceasefire
value.description: Rishi Sunak faced calls from senior Tories to back an immediate ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war as he acknowledged too many innocent lives had already been lost. A group of Conservative MPs, including three former Cabinet ministers, have written to Foreign Secretary Lord Cameron saying the case for an immediate ceasefire is “unanswerable”.

value.name: Monday evening news briefing: Sadiq Khan agreed to promote airline on trip to America
value.description: Politics | Sir Keir Starmer has backed the Government’s calls for a “sustainable ceasefire” in the Israel-Hamas war. Stephen Fry | I’m embracing my Jewish identity Israel-Hamas war | Hezbollah strikes Israel’s Iron Dome
